title: Historical Controversies and Revisionism - Collection 3
description:
Historical Controversies and Revisionism - Collection 3:

	"History is Written by the Victors." Winston Churchill

And that explains why history books are often one-sided. This series of uploads attempt at exploring the other versions of history. We have 27 titles here:

-  Banner - Being a Historian; an Introduction to the Professional World of History (2012)

-  Beck - Miracles and Massacres; True and Untold Stories of the Making of America (2013)

-  Butz - The Hoax Of The Twentieth Century; the Case Against The Presumed Extermination Of European Jewry (2003)

-  Finkelstein - Beyond Chutzpah; On the Misuse of Anti-Semitism and the Abuse of History (2008)

-  Finkelstein & Mazar - The Quest For The Historical Israel; Debating Archaeology and the History of Early Israel (2007)

-  Grant - Greek & Roman Historians; Information and Misinformation (1995)

-  Heartfield - Unpatriotic History of the Second World War (2012)

-  Hobson - The Eastern Origins of Western Civilisation (2007)

-  Hoffman et al (Eds.) - Major Problems in American History; Vol. II, Since 1865, 3e (2012)

-  Kelley - Versions of History from Antiquity to the Enlightenment (1991)

-  Knight (Ed.) - Conspiracy Theories in American History; an Encyclopedia (2003)

-  Lewis (Ed.) - American Wilderness; a New History (2007)

-  Loewenberg - Fantasy and Reality in History (1995)

-  Madaras & SoRelle - Taking Sides; Clashing Views in United States History, Vol. 1, the Colonial Period to Reconstruction, 15e (2013)

-  Mandel - The Meaning of the Second World War (1986)

-  McCullagh -The Truth of History (1998)

-  Meltzer - History Decoded; the 10 Greatest Conspiracies of All Time (2013)

-  Menzies & Hudson - Who Discovered America; the Untold History of the Peopling of the Americas (2013)

-  Oldridge - Strange Histories.. from the Medieval and Renaissance Worlds (2007)

-  Post - Who Owns America's Past; the Smithsonian and the Problem of History (2013)

-  Raddeker - Sceptical History; Feminist and Postmodern Approaches in Practice (2007)

-  Ruiz - The Terror of History; On the Uncertainties of Life in Western Civilization (2011)

-  Stinnett - Day of Deceit; the Truth about FDR and Pearl Harbor (2000)

-  Stone & Kuznick - The Untold History of the United States (2012)

-  Turner - Making Prehistory; Historical Science and the Scientific Realism Debate (2007)

-  Wheeler et al - Discovering the American Past; a Look at the Evidence, Vol. 1, to 1877, 7e (2012)

-  Widmer (Ed.) - The New York Times Disunion; Modern Historians Revisit and Reconsider the Civil War.. (2013)
